title: Impact of gate electrode on free chlorine sensing performance in solution-gated graphene field-effect transistors
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,7867-7876
DOI: 10.1039/D3RA07692J, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Masato Sugawara, Takeshi Watanabe, Yasuaki Einaga, Shinji Koh
We investigated the role of gate electrodes in solution-gated graphene field-effect transistors for sensing free chlorine. Graphene and boron-doped diamond exhibit suitable electrochemical properties for gate electrodes.
